segment.source: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files
segment.target: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files

segment.source: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files
segment.target: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files

segment.source: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files
segment.target: How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files

segment.source: Typically, debugging information is stored in a symbol file that is separate from the program.
segment.target: Typically, debugging information is stored in a symbol file that is separate from the program.

segment.source: You must have access to the symbol information when you debug an application that has stopped responding.
segment.target: You must have access to the symbol information when you debug an application that has stopped responding.

segment.source: Symbol files are automatically downloaded when you run Crash Analyzer.
segment.target: Symbol files are automatically downloaded when you run Crash Analyzer.

segment.source: If the computer does not have an Internet connection or the network requires the computer to access an HTTP proxy server, the symbol files cannot be downloaded.
segment.target: If the computer does not have an Internet connection or the network requires the computer to access an HTTP proxy server, the symbol files cannot be downloaded.

segment.source: To ensure that Crash Analyzer can access symbol files
segment.target: To ensure that Crash Analyzer can access symbol files

segment.source: Copy the dump file to another computer.
segment.target: Copy the dump file to another computer.

segment.source: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because of a lack of an Internet connection, copy the memory dump file to a computer that does have an Internet connection and run the stand-alone Crash Analyzer Wizard on that computer.
segment.target: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because of a lack of an Internet connection, copy the memory dump file to a computer that does have an Internet connection and run the stand-alone Crash Analyzer Wizard on that computer.

segment.source: Access the symbol files from another computer.
segment.target: Access the symbol files from another computer.

segment.source: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because of a lack of an Internet connection, you can download the symbols from a computer that does have an Internet connection and then copy them to the computer that does not have an Internet connection, or you can map a network drive to a location where the symbols are available on the local network.
segment.target: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because of a lack of an Internet connection, you can download the symbols from a computer that does have an Internet connection and then copy them to the computer that does not have an Internet connection, or you can map a network drive to a location where the symbols are available on the local network.

segment.source: If you run the Crash Analyzer in a Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE), you can include the symbol files on the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10 recovery image.
segment.target: If you run the Crash Analyzer in a Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE), you can include the symbol files on the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10 recovery image.

segment.source: Access symbol files through an HTTP proxy server.
segment.target: Access symbol files through an HTTP proxy server.

segment.source: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because an HTTP proxy server must be accessed, use the following steps to access an HTTP proxy server.
segment.target: If the symbols cannot be downloaded because an HTTP proxy server must be accessed, use the following steps to access an HTTP proxy server.

segment.source: In DaRT 10, the Crash Analyzer Wizard has a setting available on the Specify Symbol Files Location dialog page, marked with the label Proxy server (optional, using the format "server:port").
segment.target: In DaRT 10, the Crash Analyzer Wizard has a setting available on the Specify Symbol Files Location dialog page, marked with the label Proxy server (optional, using the format "server:port").

segment.source: You can use this text box to specify a proxy server.
segment.target: You can use this text box to specify a proxy server.

segment.source: Enter the proxy address in the form hostname:port, where the hostname is a DNS name or IP address, and the port is a TCP port number.
segment.target: Enter the proxy address in the form hostname:port, where the hostname is a DNS name or IP address, and the port is a TCP port number.

segment.source: There are two modes in which the Crash Analyzer can be run.
segment.target: There are two modes in which the Crash Analyzer can be run.

segment.source: Following is how you use the proxy setting in each of these modes:
segment.target: Following is how you use the proxy setting in each of these modes:

segment.source: Online mode: In this mode, if the proxy server field is left blank, the wizard uses the proxy settings from Internet Options in Control Panel.
segment.target: Online mode: In this mode, if the proxy server field is left blank, the wizard uses the proxy settings from Internet Options in Control Panel.

segment.source: If you enter a proxy address in the text box which is provided, that address will be used, and it will override the setting in the Internet Options.
segment.target: If you enter a proxy address in the text box which is provided, that address will be used, and it will override the setting in the Internet Options.

segment.source: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE): When you run Crash Analyzer from the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, there is no default proxy address.
segment.target: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE): When you run Crash Analyzer from the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, there is no default proxy address.

segment.source: If the computer is directly connected to the Internet, a proxy address is not required.
segment.target: If the computer is directly connected to the Internet, a proxy address is not required.

segment.source: Therefore, you can leave this field blank in the wizard setting.
segment.target: Therefore, you can leave this field blank in the wizard setting.

segment.source: If the computer is not directly connected to the Internet, and it is in a network environment that has a proxy server, you must set the proxy field in the wizard to access the symbol store.
segment.target: If the computer is not directly connected to the Internet, and it is in a network environment that has a proxy server, you must set the proxy field in the wizard to access the symbol store.

segment.source: The proxy address can be obtained from the network administrator.
segment.target: The proxy address can be obtained from the network administrator.

segment.source: Setting the proxy server is important only when the public symbol store is connected to the Internet.
segment.target: Setting the proxy server is important only when the public symbol store is connected to the Internet.

segment.source: If the symbols are already on the DaRT recovery image, or if they are available locally, setting the proxy server is not required.
segment.target: If the symbols are already on the DaRT recovery image, or if they are available locally, setting the proxy server is not required.
